metadata.name: Dragons #493
metadata.description:
A grid of many lines forming a dragon crafted on paper.
They all have their own personality... Be sure to name and take care of them.

tw: williamapan

metadata.name: Until biodiversity rains #44
metadata.description:
Audiovisual generative artwork. 

In the interpretation of biological organisms, which break paradigms by doing something different, to adapt to changes and be able to survive, paths emerge to be imitated by so many, and make life flow. The development of the work is a metaphor for those paths full of ingenuity and risk, where colorful organisms in rows open trails, sliding like subtle drops, with sophisticated turns and elastic jumps.

Some alternative paths usually hide a message along the way. Literally, one could find and read phrases in relation to biodiversity and its importance. Although it is more common to ignore them, sometimes not respect them, or what is worse, forget them. Even so, in an exacerbated insistence, here, audiovisual organizations seem to be repeating themselves, “until biodiversity rains”, and variety exploits so that ecosystems finally go it alone.


Relationship between visuals and sounds:
Biological organisms of different colors follow a path. They move forward, change shape, stop, turn. Always one after the other. At certain moments, they stretch and jump and sounds emerge.

Towards the edges of the canvas, the jumps are translated into cello sounds, mainly pizzicatos. Towards the center, the piano. From the main jumps emerges a kind of melody played by a pseudo-theremin-synth, characterized by flyaway melodies with glissant.


This artwork is 100% code, made in p5.js + tone.js.

[ Click ]  -> sound ON / OFF
[ s ] -> save 2160x2160px (in live view)
[ f ] -> fullscreen
[ p ] -> pause / play 

Note: This artwork is an animated piece, and requires a powerful GPU for optimal real-time playback. It is important to note that it may not run properly on mobile devices, especially not high-end ones.
It is recommended to run the piece in a new window from the “open” button.

attributes.name: organic paths
attributes.value: 19 in a single block, with many quadrangles

attributes.name: hidden message
attributes.value: We have met the enemy and it is us. (Walt Kelly)

metadata.name: Solace #177
metadata.description:
Solace is an algorithm that generates artworks of sand dunes. It draws hundreds of thousands of tiny points according to a probability distribution calculated from the positions of the dunes.

The logic to divide the dunes into light and dark sides is simple, but produces some interesting chaotic behaviour. These are details that weren't hard-coded but emerge organically, such as the patterns on the spines of the dunes or the stripes around their bases.

Please note that the algorithm can take some time to run, especially when the number of dunes is high.

Created by lunarean.

metadata.name: Cosmic Poems #284
metadata.description:
Cosmic Poems is the fourth iteration of my work that explores the algorithmic space of typography. In this new piece, I expand on my initial inspirations of the early concrete poetry movement bringing in texts of my own. These short texts are taken from my extensive notes on the subject of artificial intelligence. Snippets of plausible pistes of reflection as well as lighter more tongue in cheek ideas make up the selection I have curated for the work. I hope that it may engage your attention with pleasure. 

Keys : ’s’ to save PNG

Program written by Mark Webster
Font design by simonrenaud.fr

mwebster.online
@motiondesign_01

+ • + • + • + •

metadata.name: Schwere See #34
metadata.description:
Schwere See (...which is german for "Heavy Seas") this work creates completely generative ocean worlds between the real and the surreal. what is real? when do we feel reality? i guess as with many other things, we feel reality best when we're deprived of it. That might be the reason why it never ceases to fascinate us to both exaggerate and abstract nature and reality - maybe even at the same time. that's where this work tries to go... giving my best to create realistic looking waves out of hmm... thin electron-gas..., and then disrupt those from realism by unnaturally exaggerating waveforms and abstracting the display to a few colors and lines - ...well, not so few of the latter, actually ;-) beware: this needs a good GPU (at least here in 2023) to properly run in realtime. stills can still be rendered on a low end machine with on-board graphics, but for realtime playing you'd need some proper dedicated graphics card. and of course it wont run fast (or maybe not all) on your mobile phone (except maybe on a very high end device). the different mints vary in wave shape, color, camera view, animation speed, aspect ratio, frame style, hatching density, field of view, and more. some color schemes are based on pre-chosen palettes (slightly varied though), but others are wildly random-generated. there's always some risk in randomness, but lets give the error some chance to surprise us - this is one of the many benefits of generative art. as generative art can do so much more than just generate/show an image i feel almost obliged to add the possibility to animate/inteact. however, this extra control shall not be chosen without some considerations. you don't want a strobingly wild animation above your fireplace or in a doctors waiting room. nor is it motion-wise very inspiring to have subtle image stills hanging in a dancefloor. so, by default when in animation mode (-key) the scene is very slowly and steadily changing - some pieces faster, some slower. however, by pressing you can toggle to a sped up animation of waves, clouds, and scene rotation. btw, going faster in nav-mode also speeds up the wave animation. (...so be careful when you accelerate! the ocean is not a ponyfarm.) mouse/keyboard functions: ..........rotate view .........zoom in/out ...............start animation (or append '&AnimEnable=1' to the url) +<1><2><3><4>...make png screenshot in 1/2/3/4-fold resolution

...................same as +<3> ...................toggle nav-mode - navigate/fly through scene /.........accelerate in nav-mode /.......decelerate in nav-mode /.......rotate left in nav-mode /......rotate right in nav-mode ...................fast animation mode (speeds up animation) some technical info: technically this is a raymarched scene. the distance field of the waves is constructed my many localized rotations on many different scales. for the hatching no actual lines are being drawn. it is archieved by applying periodic functions in world-position-space as halftone patterns to the actual image color. the frequency of these halftone-functions thereby depending on screen-position-derivatives.

metadata.name: Charcoal Seeds #133
metadata.description:
As a fundamental element derived from organic matter, charcoal happens to be at the core of all life forms. It is also the tool for artists that dates back to the most ancient times. 
By using charcoal as the the primary medium for the exhibition ‘Organic Matr’ (and resulting series of physical pieces created in collaboration with Brooklyn-based lab ArtMatr), the works creates bonds between technology and the rawest tool that was touched by the human hand, and highlights how the cycle of life is also the cycle of regeneration of matter.

Since the generative process _that uses programming code and the intervention of randomness_ was used to design the physical pieces, the long-form generative series Charcoal Seeds is a natural way to seamlessly extend back into the digital realm the ideas of matter and physicality, while showing the elements at work in the creation process. 
In each iteration a virtual seed will encapsulates the essence of organic forms and patterns. The graphic style itself tries to convey the organic feeling of tools and materials such as chalk, ink, paintbrushes. 


—— 

- "Charcoal Seeds" offers a WYSIWYG experience : by deriving the randomness from the minter’s wallet address, it is guaranteed that what you see onscreen after adjusting the params will be your actual NFT. 
However, we wanted to allow the possibility of getting some rare features. By selecting "random" for the Format or the Paper color, you will get a chance to mint a Pink or a Back background, or have a Wide Landscape format. Beware : this will break the WYSIWYG ( but it will keep your params settings safe ) 

- As usual, the project is plottable : press [s] in live mode to generate a SVG file suited for pen plotters.

- By adding a ‘scale’ parameter in the live URL, you can generate a higher resolution image. The scale ranges from 1 to 10 with a default value of 3.

metadata.name: Phi #12
metadata.description: The golden ratio. Coded with p5js.

metadata.name: Life has no scores #125
metadata.description:
We cannot compose life, at best we hum along to the melodies that life has been played in front of us. Looking back at the scores of our lives, the notations are never neatly noted, but fully felt.  Rewinding the songs of life are our memories, whether sad, happy, angry, or melancholy. It is not clear whether I am dreaming or awake, but our songs all do end. 

In this final drop (for ?), I have reused the first ever class calligraphy(){} I have written from my genesis drop “Nothing comes from nothing”. As time passes, 10 drops later, across almost to the year, I am grateful for the progress I have made, as an artist, and more importantly as a human. After all, what is behind the code of generative art is a human being. 

Scores of music, scrolls of calligraphy, calendar or diary, notating life, time passes, and changes are inevitable. Sometimes we sing louder in laughter and joy, sometimes we scribble in uneasiness, sometimes we just get lost in neon lights. Life goes on. You and me, all the same and yet different.  

There are too many friend artists, friend collectors, fxhash team members, to thank for helping me through this journey. I would like to pay homage to Rudxane in this work, who has taken me under his wings, mentoring and encouraging me in art as well as showing me some degen stuff on the side:-). This homage is not copy-minting, or copying of styles, which I do not have the coding skills to do so even if I wanted to. But it is the influence of taste in many works of Rudxane. In a vague but agreeable taste, I present to you Life has no scores. 

What I was taught was disrupted, and grid studies left unfinished, and oh do we have a BINGO?

Tested on Chrome. Other browsers may render different or not at all (firefox)

Press ‘2’ to save png.

Copyright (©) 2022 Jimi Wen
Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Hatch Field 001 #191
metadata.description:
Genesis p5js drawing on fx(hash). Experimenting with translating recent work in done in Grasshopper exploring hatch patterns to p5.js. By Andrew Kudless / Matsys @matsysdesign
There are four feature groups:
- Base Hue: Red, Orange, Yellow, Spring Green, Green, Ocean Green, Cyan, Sky Blue, Blue, Purple, Magenta, and Crimson. Each has the same random chance of being the base color (12%).
- Hue Range: Narrow (14%), Wide (51%), and Infinite(34%)
- Lineweight: Thin (75%), Medium (10%), Thick (10%), Extra Thick (5%)
-Fray: Loose (90%), Tight (10%)

metadata.name: A Slight Case of Overbombing #16
metadata.description:
Inspired by monochromatic art of the late 60s, Russian folk-art woodblock prints, and the stylised colours of British underground comics, excited to introduce a series of bold rich landscapes. England, Wales, Ireland and Scotland represented by red, yellow, green and blue, sometimes a house or two, and groovy clouds.

Instructions ::

.     - speed up
,     - slow down
space - pause
n     - toggle noise
p     - cycle palette
h     - toggle high-res (and definitely intentional pixel shift)
s     - download and save image

metadata.name: ProcGen Entomology #483
metadata.description:
Realtime 3D in-browser procedural generation of insect-like models, with a look reminiscent of vintage entomology illustrations.

The project is about the fact that insects are cool first and foremost.
This is also about nostalgia.

Everything is procedural except for the font. The exposed features only describe the most visible parts.

I wrote mord words, about where it came from, and some technical details on the procedural aspect at:
https://ulucode.com/projects/entomology/

GPU Required!

Interface : 
Space : show/hide menu
Mouse Left : Rotate
Mouse Right : Pan
Mouse Middle/Wheel : Zoom

Captures only work in Live mode.

metadata.name: string_pllu #82
metadata.description:
Making some abstract plants, inspired by a painting technique called string pull.

Connect some random semi circles with strings and pull the strings from the bottom of the canvas.

The semi circles rotate while moving to create some random brush strokes.

metadata.name: string_pllu #72
metadata.description:
Making some abstract plants, inspired by a painting technique called string pull.

Connect some random semi circles with strings and pull the strings from the bottom of the canvas.

The semi circles rotate while moving to create some random brush strokes.

metadata.name: Phaces #58
metadata.description:
Faces + Phases = Phaces. A living artwork celebrating variety and community, with a healthy dose of delayed gratification.

Each Phace starts in black and white, a simple but fascinating look at the variety that can emerge from a few lines of code. It is a sober start to an exciting journey and a reminder that good things take time.

Each week, your Phace evolves. You’ll see the next evolution every Saturday for 12 weeks, providing moments for the collector community to come together to share and celebrate the latest Phaces – there will be some wild ones in there!

Each Phace has a name, generated from a list of 144 adjectives and a 144 names randomly selected from the US census. Other features hint at the exciting evolutions to come. You know that Nonchalant Erma with Palette = Electric and Colour Boost = Wild is going to be up for a party. 

We won’t say much more, for risk of spoiling the surprises but we can’t wait to see your Phaces emerge and evolve over these coming weeks. Follow along for updates on Twitter, Insta and at https://www.phaust.art/.

------

Edition Size: 156. A tribute to the inspiration and evolution of fxHash over the 156 day beta. 

Palettes: Azure, Bioluminant, Day Glo, Electric, Lava Lamp, Livid, Peach, Peacock, Powder, Retro, Royal, Turple.

Evolutions: 12.

S: to save current Phace. All saves are at high resolution.
G: to save a grid of all revealed Phaces.
1-9, 0, E, T: to save a specific Phace – one to nine, then ten, eleven and twelve.

metadata.name: Spher #1
metadata.description:
Spher are 3D interactive sculptures resulting from the exploration of line drawings with vertex shaders and spherical coordinates. A sculpture is formed by many lines being drawn simultaneously while folding and unfolding following patterns on the surface of a sphere.

For a full experience read the instructions and export a high resolution image of your favorite perspectives.


Instructions:

- use the mouse to navigate (zoom, pan and drag)
- press 'c' to switch between multiple camera angles
- press 'b' to pause the animation
- press 'p' to download the current view it in a custom resolution

Made with threejs and custom shaders by @bgola
Berlin, April 2022
